repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Mr. and Mrs. Russell F. Donker (donor no. 5862).

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research; for reasons of preservation; no access is permitted to the originals.

originalsloc.p: Originals of this collection are also available at the Bentley Historical Library.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, George Lockley papers [microfilm], Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: George Lockley was a resident of Ann Arbor, Michigan. During the Civil War, he served as a colonel in the 1st Michigan Infantry.

scopecontent.p: The Lockley papers include diaries, transcriptions of diaries, maps of battles in which he participated, including the first and second battles of Bull Run, Antietam, Fredericksburg, Chancellorsville and Gettysburg. Also included is a copy of a report by Lt. Colonel Benjamin D. Pritchard on the capture of Jefferson Davis and other Confederate leaders by the 4th Michigan Cavalry. There are also a few photographs and miscellaneous materials from his wartime service.

Gettysburg, Battle of, Gettysburg, Pa., 1863.

did.unittitle: Civil War Diary of George Lockley (galleys of book)
Maps of Civil War battles in which George Lockley participated
Account (copy) by Lt. Colonel Benjamin D. Pritchard on the capture of Jefferson Davis and other Confederate leaders by the 4th Michigan Cavalry
Civil War miscellanea, including key to diary code
Photographs: portraits of Lockley in uniform; also portraits of his wife, Amelia Lockley, and of other soldiers; and copy prints of Civil War documents.
